creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: five carved wooden blocks, each with a different stage of woodblock print process; blocks mounted to wooden frame; at bottom center is the finished print of a baby's face enveloped in its mothers arms; mother is wearing green kimono with pink and white motif
marks: Signature, Title, Date, and Marks bottom margin of print, in pencil: [Haha a/p Micah
title: Print blocks (gendai hanga)
